intro: Kyllinga mtotomwema, commonly known as the African arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular, arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets of flowers. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found near water sources. Kyllinga mtotomwema is adapted to humid climates and can be found in various habitats such as swamps and riverbanks.
